thread.title: Colorado's Alpine Rescue Team sent on three rescue missions over the weekend
thread.title_full: Colorado's Alpine Rescue Team sent on three rescue missions over the weekend

author: @KKCO11News
title: Colorado's Alpine Rescue Team sent on three rescue missions over the weekend
text:
Colorado’s Alpine Rescue Team sent on three rescue missions over the weekend
CLEAR CREEK COUNTY, Colo. (KKTV) - Colorado’s Alpine Rescue Team responded to three separate, simultaneous missions on Sunday.
Crews said the day began with a call of a hiker suffering from altitude sickness on Kelso Ridge in Dillon. They said a Flight for Life was called in to help find the hiker, as well as help crew members into the field.
Because of the weather, rescue members said they could not shuttle down from the helicopter to help. Instead, they said teams on the ground were able to go up the mountain and help the hiker back down.
During the first call, rescue members said they were alerted to two more missions at Saint Mary’s Glacier in Clear Creek County.
Crews said both people had fallen and were injured. They said one person was evacuated from the slabs west of the lake, and the other was evacuated from Fox Mountain Road.
Rescue teams were able to find both of those hikers as well.
"As we head into the summer months it’s important to remember that a helicopter is never plan A, not even for rescuers. There are many factors outside our control that can limit aerial support,“ the Alpine Rescue Team said. ”Regardless of how we get to you, we’re always happy to assist those having a bad day in the mountains."
